channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scumbags part two, 8th February
item.description:
When you’ve cleared this, Mr. Bin man try and put the bins back up against the wall so people can’t hide behind and throw their rubbish.

item.title: Street needs general cleaning!, 8th February
item.description:
- Rubbish next to the bike hoop on top of the street (close to number 42 - Orange peels and other rubbish between 39, 37, 35, 33 And scattered elsewhere on the street as well! Needs a clean

item.title: Between malvern road and Stafford rd, 8th February
item.description:
Very big collection of slushy dead leaves please could you clear ? Thank you. It is affecting children ability to play and it's a bit of a safety issue thank you so much

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stafford Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole clanking again, 8th February
item.description:
This manhole cover was fixed on April 14th 2025. It has started clanking again. I reported it on 29th December 2025 to email : Highways@southwark.gov.uk. This was who had fixed it in April 2025. They emailed me advising me that the road is maintained by TFL, and copied londonstreets@tfl.gov.uk into the reply. I have emailed three times and not had a reply. I have now resorted to this website. Please can you tell me who maintains this road and if the manhole can be fixed. There is also a second manhole clanking outside The Pommelers Rest Pub on Tower Bridge Road. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive vandalism in tunnel under Wells Way, 8th February
item.description:
In the tunnel connecting the two sides of Burgess Park (under wells way road), someone has put up very disturbing wooden plaques of knives, machetes and axes? They have also written gang slang on the wooden boats hung up by the park. It’s is really very disturbing as many of us commute past these images daily on our way to work. I love burgess park and it upsets me that this has happened and has been up for several weeks now, but nothing is being done about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Wells Way, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Flytip of beds, bags, rubbish.

item.title: Poor road surface, 8th February
item.description:
The whole of shooter's hill needs re-surfacing.there are deep potholes,collapsing manholes and deep potholes everywhere.the brow of the hill is the worst and there is no way to avoid the awful road surface.this whole road needs attention.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill Road, Blackheath

item.title: Rubbish along from Edgebury school all the way along Slades Drive and into the cul de sac., 8th February
item.description:
Rubbish all along Slades Drive from Edgebury school and into cul de sac. It has been blown into the bushes along the path and roadway. There is also a roller blind that's been there for weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81-87, Slades Drive, Greater London

item.title: Cycle lane traffic island has no illumination or warning bollards, 8th February
item.description:
It's happened again! The second time this weekend and the fifth time that we are of. Photos show damage to the underside of this car - it's undriveable with bodywork jammed on the near side front wheel and the airbag inflated. This is outside 122/124 College Road, SE19 1XD. Please sort this island out before more cars are damaged! We don't even no why the island is there. It is a hazard to motoring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken tarmac around drain, 8th February
item.description:
Tarmac broken around drain on a relatively narrow stretch of Green Lane, so cars do go over it frequently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Various items, 8th February
item.description:
Reported for the 4th time. Still there, against the dense, someone’s chucked a microwave on the top for good measure. If you leave it, people will just keep dumping stuff here. Please please please please remove ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Durning Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two big potholes next to each other getting bigger, 8th February
item.description:
I think that this is a pothole that was "fixed" a week ago but has now opened up at both ends of the new tarmac. This is as to come onto Radbourne Road from Weir Road. The rest of Radbourne Road has smaller potholes (although dangerous for cyclists) and the road looks as if it is breaking up in many places.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radbourne Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several cracked pavement slabs outside 29 Bedwell house residential flats SW9 6AG Brixton road., 8th February
item.description:
I like to report several cracked pavement slabs outside number 29 Bedwell house residential flats on Brixton Road SW9. The cracked slabs have raised ends which could possibly prove fatal if someone has a mis-step over them. Please could they be repaired at your earliest convenience. It seems a heavy truck or dustbin lorry may have drove onto it thus causing the substantial damage. The pavements has been like this for over two months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Mews, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at Andrews Lane x Jubilee Close intersection, 8th February
item.description:
Illegally dumped waste at the intersection of Andrews Lane and Jubilee Close, EN7 6FA. The rubbish needs to be cleared.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human excrement on pavement for last 10 days, 8th February
item.description:
There is a pile of what looks like human excrement on the pavement outside nos. 23 and 25. It’s been there for over a week. It has been stepped in several times and spread all over the pavement, so it’s now difficult to avoid without walking on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, De Crespigny Park, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy slippery pavement. Note this is the only pavement on this busy road leading to primary school and church, 8th February
item.description:
This dangerous pavement is mucky and slippy and has been reported many times over several months and Enfield Council has done nothing to repair it knowing it is the only oavement that parents and children can use to get to their school and for parishioners young and onld to reach their church.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfall Road, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
